content.description: Start sitting on some small crimps in the crumbly rock down low. Pull up into the arete feature and cut right to a long crimp rail. Make a big move to the lip and press it out. Good problem that is detracted by the rock quality down low.
content.location: Left side of the good trouble wall

content.description: A personal favorite and maybe easier in better conditions. Start in the choss crack band and crank up into the overhanging rail feature. An undercling, knee pad and several slaps lead to a unique 1.5 finger pocket and a befuddling final crux.
content.location: First obvious line on the good trouble wall

content.description: From the crescent jug, pull into the side pull, get a high foot and gun for the top and another press to the top
content.location: In between white fragility and good trouble

content.description: A nice left to right traverse on the wall up and to the right from the approach slab from the middle tier. The top out of this climb is also the down climb for the climbs on the good trouble wall
content.protection: Couple pads, the landing in the crux is a bit rough.
content.location: At the top of the stream bed that feeds into the namesake waterfall

content.description: Cliff band above the middle tier. Rock quality is generally worse than the middle tier, but overhanging corners and other features litter this 15-20 foot wall
